pageContext.description: A depiction of Christ's arrest with many figures, the scene of Judas' kiss is central, in the foreground on the left Peter returns his sword to its sheath while Malchus lies on the ground and cries with pain.

pageContext.markings:
Reverse of the panel/cradle: 
- on the vertical batten, top left: 
Inscription in red chalk: '1467' 
- on the vertical batten, top centre: 
Paper label: 'II. D. u. N. I. 40.' 
- on the same vertical batten, below: 
Paper label: 'C.I. LUC. CRANACH. Nro 54.' 
- on the vertical batten, bottom centre: 
Inscription on pencil: '2 St. 17    A D S    No 50.'
- on the vertical batten, bottom right: 
Stamp: 'GJ 1949' 
- on the vertical batten, bottom right: 
Inventory label: 'Gemälde Galerie des Allerh. Kaiserhauses No 860'
arin Christus im Garten

metadata.title: Christ's Arrest

pageContext.provenance:
One of a series of nine panels depicting scenes from the Passion (FR369 - 374D), and which was originally part of the altarpiece in the Berlin Cathedral (Friedländer, Rosenberg)
- Archduke Leopold Wilhelm's Collection, Inventory 1659, No. 285: 'Ein großes Stuckh von Öhlfarb auf Holcz, warin Christus im Gartten von dem Juda gekhusst vnndt von den Juden gefangen wirdt - Original von Lucas Crainich'
- [Mechel 1783, 248, No. 49]
- [Engerth, Cat. Vienna 1906, III, No. 1474]
- [Cat. Vienna 1928, GNo. 1467]

[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2011]
pageContext.relatedWorks:
- Variant (with regards the composition) from the Cranach workshop: London art market 2002 (Trafalgar Galleries, photograph in the documentation file, in the GG of the KHM)
- the accompanying Predella depicting 'Joab stabbing Abner', Greenville, USA (formerly Gemäldegalerie, KHM, Inv. No. 873)
pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia bottom left (13.5 cm from the left/2 cm from the bottom): winged serpent with dropped wings and dated '1538'; in yellow paint
[Kunsthistorisches Museum, revised 2011]
